intro: Hyptis colubrimontis var. yutajeensis, commonly known as Yutajé hyptis, is a perennial shrub native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually violet or purple in color, arranged in dense clusters. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
